intro: Lavatera maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan woolly mallow, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant. Lavatera maroccana is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
